    • Method Detail

      • retrieveSavedIdentity

        public static void retrieveSavedIdentity(android.widget.EditText editTextId,
                                         android.widget.Switch switchSaveIdentity,
                                         android.app.Activity activity)
        This method retrieves the user identity that is saved in the device (if there is any) and sets the identity edit text with that identity. It is used in the TicketAllocatorFragment and in the TicketSearcherFragment
        Parameters:
        editTextId - the edit text to set with the identity
        switchSaveIdentity - the switch to set checked if the identity isn't empty every time that the fragment is created
        activity - the application context/activity

      • saveIdentity

        public static void saveIdentity(android.widget.EditText editTextId,
                                android.widget.Switch switchSaveIdentity,
                                android.app.Activity activity)
        This method saves the identity typed in the edit text of either the TicketAllocatorFragment or the TicketSearcherFragment if the switch is checked
        Parameters:
        editTextId - the edit text in which the identity is being typed
        switchSaveIdentity - the switch that gives a condition to save the identity or not
        activity - the application context/activity

      • getDeviceName

        public static java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        This method gets the current device name defined as the manufacturer plus the phone model
        Returns:
        String with the device name

      • formatDate

        public static java.lang.String formatDate(java.lang.String inputDate)
        This method receives a string date with a format used by the backend and puts it in the format desired to be shown in the frontend
        Parameters:
        inputDate - the string with the date to be formatted
        Returns:
        String with the formatted date

      • encodeAsBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap encodeAsBitmap(java.lang.String str,
                                                     int size)
        This method gets a String to be encoded as a QRCode bitmap of a given size
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be encoded
        size - the size of the returned bitmap
        Returns:
        Bitmap of a QRCode that encodes the given String

      • resizeImage

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap resizeImage(android.graphics.Bitmap input,
                                                  double width)
        Resize a Bitmap to a given width keeping its aspect ratio
        Parameters:
        input - the Bitmap to be resized
        width - the width of the returned Bitmap
        Returns:
        Bitmap resized to the given width keeping the original aspect ratio

        method to captalize a String
        Parameters:

        Returns:
